UI_visible_response: Read 32 web pagesView Page Details“China’s Wailing Wall” refers to the Weibo page of Dr. Li Wenliang, an ophthalmologist at Wuhan Central Hospital who was one of the early whistleblowers of the COVID-19 outbreak. After he contracted the virus and passed away on February 7, 2020, his Weibo page became a space where hundreds of thousands of netizens could express their grief, share their thoughts, and call for justice. It was likened to the Wailing Wall in Jerusalem, a place of mourning and prayer. This digital “Wailing Wall” allowed people to collectively mourn and voice their concerns, becoming a significant platform for emotional expression and social commentary.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: “China’s Wailing Wall” refers to the Weibo page of Dr. Li Wenliang, an ophthalmologist at Wuhan Central Hospital who was one of the early whistleblowers of the COVID-19 outbreak[^1^]. After he contracted the virus and passed away on February 7, 2020, his Weibo page became a space where hundreds of thousands of netizens could express their grief, share their thoughts, and call for justice[^1^]. It was likened to the Wailing Wall in Jerusalem, a place of mourning and prayer[^1^]. This digital “Wailing Wall” allowed people to collectively mourn and voice their concerns, becoming a significant platform for emotional expression and social commentary[^1^].
